DISCLAIMER.Definition: a warning or statement to avoid responsibility for something

STATE-SANCTIONED.Definition: approved or allowed by the government

SNEAKING.Definition: moving in a secret way to avoid being noticed

RAPE.Definition: a serious crime involving forced sexual activity

TAVERN.Definition: a place like a pub where people drank alcohol

DETERRENT.Definition: something that would make people stop or avoid doing something bad

PROSPECT.Definition: the possibility of it happening in the future

DIVINE.Definition: relating to God or a higher power

BLASPHEMY.Definition: speaking disrespectfully about god or religion

WITCHCRAFT.Definition: the practice of magic or casting spells

STAKE.Definition: a wooden post used to tie people to for burning

TOUCHED ON.Definition: mentioned briefly or talked about a little bit

TRACED BACK TO.Definition: found or discovered to have started by

INCONSISTENT.Definition: not steady or the same throughout

FINE.Definition: a sum of money paid as punishment

SUFFICIENT.Definition: enough or as much as needed

GLORIFIED.Definition: made to seem better or more important than they were

THREAT.Definition: a warning or danger of harm

WOULD-BE.Definition: someone who wanted to be one in the future, potential

NODDING ALONG.Definition: showing agreement by moving your head up and down

PREVAILING.Definition: most common or widespread at that time

FORFEITED.Definition: lost or given up as a punishment

RETRIBUTION.Definition: punishment given in return for a crime, revenge

ABOLISHED.Definition: ended or done away with by law

DRASTICALLY.Definition: in a very big or extreme way

TENDS.Definition: usually does or happens in that way

EDUCATED GUESSES.Definition: guesses based on knowledge or information

STUDIOUSLY.Definition: in a careful or detailed way

GUT INSTINCT.Definition: a natural or immediate feeling about it

OUTDATED.Definition: no longer useful or relevant, old-fashioned

RELIC.Definition: something from the past that is still around
